other_tests.findings: Low serum aldosterone, elevated serum ACTH, normal basal cortisol.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At 2 years of age after hydrocortisone withdrawal, a high basal ACTH with a blunted cortisol response was observed.

other_tests.findings: Marked delayed bone age with pseudoepiphysis in the second, fourth, and fifth metacarpals; slightly flared metaphyses.

other_tests.date: At 1 year 8 months after 1 dose of hydrocortisone withdrawal

other_tests.findings: In patient 2, after treatment, the patient promptly recovered, and a normal renal ultrasound was noted.

other_tests.procedure_name: Urinary calcium to creatinine ratio test
other_tests.findings: Normal during initial assessments, elevated during treatment with sodium chloride.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Elevated while receiving sodium chloride supplements.
